slides.title: The PHP Framework üêò
slides.content:
# Laravel

The most popular PHP framework.

Key features:
- Elegant syntax.
- Powerful ecosystem (Blade, Eloquent, Queues).
- Developer happiness focused.

slides.title: Installation
slides.content:
# via Composer üéº

Create a new project:

`composer create-project laravel/laravel example-app`

Or using the Laravel Installer:
`laravel new example-app`

slides.title: Directory Structure
slides.content:
# Where things live üè†

- `app/`: Core logic (Models, Controllers).
- `routes/`: URL definitions.
- `resources/`: Views, JS, CSS.
- `database/`: Migrations, seeders.
- `public/`: Entry point (`index.php`), assets.

slides.title: Serving the App
slides.content:
# Artisan Serve üèÉ

Laravel comes with a built-in dev server.

`php artisan serve`

Starts server at `http://127.0.0.1:8000`.

slides.title: Environment Config
slides.content:
# .env File üîß

Store API keys and DB credentials here.

`APP_NAME=Laravel`
`DB_DATABASE=laravel`

Never commit `.env` to git!
